name: Catholic Charities of Denver - English as a Second Language (ESL) Classes
address: 2830 Lawrence Street, Denver, Colorado, 80205 (Centro San Juan Diego)
phone: (303) 295-2515 (Annunciation Catholic School, which may have related programs) or contact Citlalli Lopez at clopez@ccdenver.org for ESL volunteer opportunities
description: Offers various levels of ESL classes, both virtual and in-person, with a focus on practical language for workforce readiness and community integration
services: Catholic-owned EFL instruction in Colorado consultation

name: Catholic Charities of Central Colorado - English as a Second Language (ESL)
address: While they previously offered ESL classes, they have ceased offering them as of July 1, 2022. They now provide information on other community organizations
description: Previously offered ESL and citizenship preparation classes. They now refer individuals to local school districts, churches, and libraries for these services
services: Catholic-owned EFL instruction in Colorado consultation

name: Annunciation Catholic School
description: A Catholic school offering education for students in Preschool through 8th grade. While not exclusively an EFL instruction business, they are a Catholic institution in Denver
services: Catholic-owned EFL instruction in Colorado consultation

name: Escuela de Guadalupe
description: A private, dual-language Catholic school serving grades Pre-Kindergarten through 8th, with classes taught in both Spanish and English
services: Catholic-owned EFL instruction in Colorado consultation

name: Catholic Charities of Southern Colorado - Immigration Services
address: Multiple locations, including Pueblo. Specific address for ESL classes not detailed in search results
description: Offers immigration services which include ESL classes and citizenship test preparation
services: Catholic-owned EFL instruction in Colorado consultation

name: Catholic Charities of Larimer County
address: 460 Linden Center Drive, Fort Collins, Colorado, 80524
description: Provides various services to the community, and while specific EFL programs are not detailed, they collaborate with local agencies and may offer or refer to such services

name: St. John the Evangelist Catholic School
description: A Catholic private school offering education from Kindergarten through 8th grade, with preschool programs. They focus on academic and spiritual development

name: Intercambio Uniting Communities
address: Boulder County, Colorado (in-person classes) and online. Specific addresses for in-person classes vary
description: Offers English classes for adults with seven levels of instruction, both in-person and online. While not exclusively Catholic-owned, they serve diverse communities and offer citizenship classes

name: Adult and Family Education (District 11)
address: Roy J Wasson Academic Campus, 2115 Afton Way, Colorado Springs, CO 80909
description: Offers free English Language Classes (ESL) for adults, with a focus on improving reading, writing, speaking, and listening skills for workplace and community integration

name: English Connect (Aurora, Colorado)
address: Laredo Building, 950 Laredo St, Aurora, Colorado, 80111
description: A church-sponsored English learning program that utilizes volunteers to help newcomers learn English. While not explicitly Catholic, it's a community-based program
